thread.title: Gamer dies while taking part in 24-hour live-streaming marathon | Metro News
thread.title_full: Gamer dies while taking part in 24-hour live-streaming marathon | Metro News

author: Tomeyjes For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Gamer dies while taking part in 24-hour live-streaming marathon | Metro News
text:
Toby Meyjes for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 22 Feb 2017 10:44 pm Brian Vigneault had stepped away from the stream he was running at home (Picture: Facebook/Brian Vigneault) 
A gamer has died while taking part in a 24-hour livestreaming marathon for charity. 
Brian Vigneault had stepped away from the stream he was hosting at home at around 4.30pm but failed to return, according to PVPLive . 
Police were called to his home in Virginia an hour later where they found an ‘unresponsive individual’. 
According to reports, he was found dead at the scene and police are investigating. 
The gamer regular hosted streams on his Twitch channel, reported the New York Post , but may have died from heart complications linked to severe sleep deprivation, PVP Live suggested. He was taking part in a 24 hour live stream (Picture: Twitch) 
World of Tanks’ publisher, Wargaming.net , released a statement on Vigneault’s death. 
‘Wargaming is saddened to hear of the loss of streamer and tanker Brian Vigneault, aka ‘PoShYbRiD,’ a devoted player of World of Tanks and contributor to the Make-A-Wish foundation. 
‘We offer our most sincere condolences to his family and friends during this difficult time.’ More
